points.quoteText: If you create an account on the Service, you are responsible for maintaining the security of your account and data, and you are fully responsible for all activities that occur under the account.

points.title: Provides instructions on how to submit a copyright claim
points.quoteText:
Click here to submit a copyright infringement notification. We review and take action on these reports promptly.

If you do not wish to submit your DMCA notice using our online form, you may also send a copyright infringement notification to us by email or mail. Your request must include the following information per Section 512(c)(3) of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act:

  1. Valid contact information for you or a representative authorized to act on your behalf
    You need to provide information that will allow us and the uploaders of any sets, classes, folders, or other removed content to contact you regarding the complaint. In general, contact information must include:
    1. Full legal name (a first and last name, not a company name)
    2. Email address
    3. Physical address
    4. Telephone number
  2. A description of the work being infringed
    You must clearly and completely describe the copyrighted content you are seeking to protect. If multiple copyrighted works are covered in the complaint, the law allows you to include a representative list of such works.
  3. Each allegedly infringing piece of content’s specific URL
    You should always include the specific URL of the content believed to infringe on your copyright(s). General information about the content, such as a folder, search term or username, is usually not sufficient unless also accompanied by a detailed explanation that allows us to identify the content in question clearly and unambiguously (e.g., a statement that all public content created by the user is infringing)
    In general, however, submissions should identify content via a specific URL in one of the following formats:
    1. www.quizlet.com/#####/xxxxxx
    2. www.quizlet.com/class/###### (with an accompanying detailed explanation)
    3. www.quizlet.com/username/folders/xxxxxx (with an accompanying detailed explanation)
  4. You must agree to and/or include the following statements:
    1. “I have a good faith belief that the use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.”
    2. "The information in this notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, I am the owner, or an agent authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.”
  5. The request must include your signature:
    Complete complaints require your physical or electronic signature or the signature of a representative authorized to act on your behalf. To satisfy this requirement, you (or your representative) may type your full legal name to act as your signature at the bottom of the complaint or in the Quizlet DMCA submission form.

You can submit your DMCA notice by email to dmca@quizlet.com or by mail to:

Quizlet, Inc.
ATTN: DMCA Agent
501 2nd Street, Suite 500
San Francisco CA, 94107 USA

points.title: Users agree not to submit libelous, harassing or threatening content
points.quoteText: abusive, threatening, obscene, defamatory or libelous;</

points.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
points.quoteText:
For instance, we may also use web beacons, flash cookies, and similar technologies.
We also use local storage, which allows data to be stored locally on your browser or device and includes HTML5 local storage and browser cache.

points.title: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data
points.status:
Quote: "How we use your information We collect information about you when you use the Service for a variety of reasons in order to support Quizlet and to enable our team to continue to create engaging experiences for our users. 
Providing, Analyzing, Improving and Developing the Service 
We process the data we collect about you to operate, improve and develop the Quizlet Service, including providing, maintaining, securing and improving our services, developing new ones, and protecting Quizlet and our users. We are able to deliver our services, personalize content, and make suggestions for you by using this information to understand how you use and interact with our services. We conduct surveys and research, test features in development, and analyze the information we have to evaluate and improve products and services, develop new products or features, and conduct audits and troubleshooting activities. Here are some examples of how we use this information:
Providing, maintaining and improving the Quizlet Service. The information we collect from you allows us to help you log in, host your content, and use the various study tools we have. It also allows us learn about how you and others use Quizlet to help create new activities and services, like Quizlet Live. Improving, personalizing and facilitating your use of the Service. When you sign up and use a Quizlet account, we may associate certain information with your new account, such as information about other Quizlet accounts you had or currently have, and your prior usage of the Service. For example, we use information collected from cookies and other technologies, like pixel tags, to save your language preferences, so we will be able to have our services appear in the language you prefer. We do this in order to ensure that content from the Service is presented in the most effective manner for you. Measuring, tracking and analyzing trends and usage in connection with your use or the performance of the Service."
points.quoteText:
